notable_quotes.speaker: Jean fils Nicolas Colombain
notable_quotes.french: qu'ilz y tuoient des escurons et un porc sauvage, qu'il y avoit un grand homme noire appelé Brice, et du depuis a dit qu'il s'appelloit Mescaigne, ayant une chemise noire, qui mectoit la main derrier le dos et saultoit, et que c'estoit luy qui les appelloit pour y aller, qu'il avoit sur chasque espaule une petite corne noire
notable_quotes.english: They killed squirrels and a wild boar there, that there was a great black man called Brice, and afterwards he said he was called Mescaigne, wearing a black shirt, who put his hand behind his back and jumped, and that it was he who called them to go there, that he had on each shoulder a small black horn
notable_quotes.context: First interrogation describing sabbat activities and the devil

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean fils Nicolas Colombain
notable_quotes.french: qu'il veoit bien que mauvaise caigne la trompé, que par sa foid il est bien marry d'avoir esté et ny veult plus aller
notable_quotes.english: He sees well that evil one deceived him, that by his faith he is very sorry to have been there and does not want to go there anymore
notable_quotes.context: End of first interrogation expressing remorse

notable_quotes.speaker: Court clerk
notable_quotes.french: ne pouvants bonnement entendre ledit Jean qui ne peut ouvrir la bouche qu'a demy ayant les levres emportées en sorte que les dents paroissent pour avoir esté mordu estant petit enfant au berceau
notable_quotes.english: Not being able to properly understand said Jean who can only open his mouth halfway, having his lips carried away such that his teeth show, from having been bitten as a small infant in the cradle
notable_quotes.context: Description of Jean's severe facial disfigurement requiring interpreter

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean fils Nicolas Colombain
notable_quotes.french: c'estoit du pisset de chevaux, que Maiscraigne les en espergeoit
notable_quotes.english: It was horse piss, that Maiscraigne sprinkled them with it
notable_quotes.context: Describing the 'holy water' used at black mass

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean fils Nicolas Colombain
notable_quotes.french: que Maiscraigne estoit le diable ainsy que la fille Richard luy avoit dit et qu'elle fut bien battue pour l'avoir dit dudit Maiscraigne
notable_quotes.english: That Maiscraigne was the devil as Richard's daughter told him and that she was well beaten for having said it by said Maiscraigne
notable_quotes.context: Describing how Remiere Richard identified the devil and was punished

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an extraordinary case of a 12-year-old boy with severe facial disfigurement (bitten as infant) requiring an interpreter. No witnesses testified; the trial consists entirely of Jean's confessions about attending sabbat with his mother (witch 18). He provided extremely detailed descriptions of sabbat rituals including black mass parody. His mother had already been tried (w018). The case involved confrontations where both Jean and his mother maintained accusations despite denials. No evidence of torture. Final outcome unclear from document. Cross-reference with w018 (mother Mengeotte) essential for full understanding.
